ai-snp5.5:1.1_0: “I ask you, Fortunate One, please tell this to me,
ai-snp5.5:1.3_0: I think you have true understanding, and a developed self -
ai-snp5.5:1.4_0: how have these countless kinds of suffering
ai-snp5.5:1.5_0: Of those who know the world.”
ai-snp5.5:2.1_0: “You asked me about the origin of suffering,
ai-snp5.5:2.3_0: as I know it I will declare it to you:
ai-snp5.5:2.4_0: Because of clinging to a basis
ai-snp5.5:3.1_0: The foolish one, without wisdom, clings to a basis,
ai-snp5.5:3.2_0: that idiot returns to suffering again and again.
ai-snp5.5:3.3_0: So let one who understands not build up attachments:
ai-snp5.5:3.4_0: seeing the birth and origin of suffering.”
ai-snp5.5:4.1_0: “This is what we have done, not what is unself.
ai-snp5.5:4.2_0: Please ask another question, Please tell this to me.
ai-snp5.5:4.3_0: How do the wise ones cross over the flood
ai-snp5.5:4.4_0: of birth, old age, grief, and lamentation?
ai-snp5.5:4.5_0: Please explain this to me, O sage,
ai-snp5.5:4.6_0: for this Teaching has been understood by you.”
ai-snp5.5:5.1_0: “What can I teach you the Dhamma for you?
ai-snp5.5:5.4_0: When a person understands the mindful and
ai-snp5.5:5.5_0: like the sunk in the world.”
ai-snp5.5:6.3_0: When a person understands the mindful and
ai-snp5.5:6.4_0: like the sunk in the world.”
ai-snp5.5:7.3_0: above, below, and across the middle,
ai-snp5.5:7.4_0: (There are) not seen these rivers and homes,
ai-snp5.5:8.1_0: Living in this way, mindful, and heedful,
ai-snp5.5:8.2_0: the monk who lives on after giving up loved things,
ai-snp5.5:8.3_0: of birth, old age, grief, and lamentation?
ai-snp5.5:8.4_0: grief, lamentation, and suffering right here.”
ai-snp5.5:9.1_0: “I greatly rejoice in that, the great hermit!
ai-snp5.5:9.2_0: Gotamaks, well proclaimed is freedom from cleaving.
ai-snp5.5:9.3_0: Surely the Fortunate One gave up suffering,
ai-snp5.5:9.4_0: for this Teaching has been understood by you.
ai-snp5.5:10.2_0: whomever you would continually advise, O Sage,
ai-snp5.5:10.3_0: therefore having met the future, I revere you,
ai-snp5.5:10.4_0: May the Buddha please advise me
ai-snp5.5:11.1_0: “That brāhmaṇa who has true understanding, a knowledge master,
ai-snp5.5:11.2_0: who has nothing, and is not clinging to sense existence,
ai-snp5.5:11.3_0: for he has surely crossed over the flood,
ai-snp5.5:11.4_0: without hindrance or doubt, he has crossed beyond.
ai-snp5.5:12.1_0: That man who is wise, and has true understanding,
ai-snp5.5:12.2_0: who has released the shackle of repeated existence,
ai-snp5.5:12.3_0: he is craving-free, not troubled, not yearning -
ai-snp5.5:12.4_0: they’ve crossed over birth and old age, I declare.”
